hints.content:
To find the number of rungs she climbed before the cat went farther up the tree, we start where she is now at $\blue{45}$ rungs and subtract the $\pink{18}$ more rungs she climbed.

$\blue{45}-\pink{18} = \green{\Box}$

![](${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/c541843fce9581d9ede18a1e690c30c9.png)
The firefighter had climbed $\green{27}$ rungs of her ladder before the cat went farther up the tree.

question.content:
A firefighter climbs several rungs of her ladder to help rescue a cat from a tree.  

Oh no!  The cat just ran farther up the tree, so the firefighter climbs $18$ more rungs to get to the top of her ladder. Now she has climbed $45$ rungs of her ladder.

**How many rungs had the firefighter climbed before the cat went farther up the tree?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] rungs
